table.name: patient_data
table.comments: Main patient record that contains patient demographic information

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: uuid
column.comments: UUID of the record

column.name: pharmacy_id
column.comments: The patient's default pharmacy to send prescriptions to

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier used throughout the export to represent this unique patient record

column.name: pubpid
column.comments: The public facing Medical Record Number (MRN) of the patient

column.name: care_team_provider
column.comments: List of care team providers where each id is the provider id contained in the users.id. Entries are separated by a the pipe | symbol.

column.name: care_team_facility
column.comments: List of care team facilities where each id is the facility/organization id contained in the facilities.id. Entries are separated by a the pipe | symbol

column.name: providerID
column.comments: The id of the assigned provider to this user

column.name: ref_providerID
column.comments: The id of the user that referred this patient

column.name: created_by
column.comments: The id of the user that initially created this record

column.name: updated_by
column.comments: The id of the user that last updated this record

column.name: title
column.comments: Title of the patient

column.name: language

column.name: financial
column.comments: Financial information of the patient

column.name: fname

column.name: lname

column.name: mname

column.name: DOB

column.name: street

column.name: ss

column.name: occupation

column.name: phone_home

column.name: phone_biz

column.name: phone_contact

column.name: phone_cell

column.name: status

column.name: contact_relationship

column.name: date

column.name: sex

column.name: referrer

column.name: referrerID

column.name: email

column.name: email_direct

column.name: ethnoracial

column.name: migrantseasonal

column.name: family_size

column.name: monthly_income
column.comments: Monthly income information of the patient

column.name: billing_note
column.comments: Billing notes for the patient

column.name: homeless

column.name: financial_review

table.name: lists
table.comments: Patient issues list including allergies, medical problems, medications, medical devices, surgeries, and dental issues. Type of issue is in the type column.

column.name: id
column.comments: Primary identifier of the record

column.name: uuid
column.comments: UUID of the record

column.name: date
column.comments: Date the issue was created

column.name: type
column.comments: The type of the issue (allergy, medication, etc) where the issue_types.category='default'

column.name: subtype
column.comments: The sub type of the issue where the list_options.list_id='issue_subtypes'

column.name: title
column.comments: The human readable description of the issue

column.name: udi
column.comments: The unique device identifier. Populated if the issue is of type medical_device

column.name: udi_data
column.comments: The JSON serialized medical device as returned from the https://accessgudid.nlm.nih.gov/api/v2/devices/lookup.json api. Populated if the issue is of type medical_device

column.name: begdate
column.comments: The beginning date for when this issue occurred as reported by the patient or the provider

column.name: enddate
column.comments: The end date for when this issue occurred as reported by the patient or the provider

column.name: returndate
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: occurrence
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='occurrence' and is the frequency that this issue occurs for the patient

column.name: classification
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: referredby
column.comments: The human readable name of Referring physician and practice

column.name: extrainfo
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: diagnosis
column.comments: The diagnosis of the issue. Format is a text string in the format of 'system:code[;system:code2;system:coden]'

column.name: activity
column.comments: Value of 0 means the record has been deleted, 1 means the record is active in the system

column.name: comments
column.comments: Human readable additional notes/comments of the issue

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: user
column.comments: The user that created or last updated this issue

column.name: groupname
column.comments: The user group that created or last updated this issue

column.name: outcome
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='outcome' and represents the outcome of the issue

column.name: destination
column.comments: Human readable name of GP, Secondary care specialist, etc.

column.name: reinjury_id
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: injury_part
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: injury_type
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: injury_grade
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: reaction
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='reaction' and represents the reaction of the patient to the allergy

column.name: verification
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='allergyintolerance-verification' and represents the confirmation status of the allergy

column.name: external_allergyid
column.comments: An identifier for an allergy from an external eRx system

column.name: erx_source
column.comments: O if the allergy issue originated in OpenEMR, 1 if the allergy issue originated in an external system

column.name: erx_uploaded
column.comments: O if allergy is still waiting to be uploaded to an external system (such as eRX), 1 if the allergy issue has been successfully received by the eRX system

column.name: modifydate
column.comments: The date the issue record was last modified

column.name: severity_al
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='severity_ccda' and represents the severity of the allergic reaction of the patient to the allergy

column.name: external_id
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: list_option_id
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id=CONCAT(lists.type,'_issue_list') and represents the prefilled list option id that was chosen as a template to create this issue

table.name: issue_types
table.comments: Contains the list of issue types that medical health issue can be.

table.name: list_options
table.comments: Contains lists of unique value sets that a record's property can be. Individual values/options in the list may be linked to a specific codesystem

column.name: list_id
column.comments: The internal lists identifier

column.name: created_by
column.comments: The user that created this record

table.name: history_data
table.comments: Contains patient eating,sleeping,drinking,drug habits as well as other patient health history information

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: created_by
column.comments: The user that created this record

table.name: patient_history
table.comments: Contains previous historical entries of the patient's care team (providers and facilities) as well as patient previous name information

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: care_team_provider
column.comments: List of care team providers where each id is the provider id contained in the users.id. Entries are separated by a the pipe | symbol.

column.name: care_team_facility
column.comments: List of care team facilities where each id is the facility/organization id contained in the facilities.id. Entries are separated by a the pipe | symbol

column.name: created_by
column.comments: The user that created this record

table.name: prescriptions
table.comments: Internal and External prescription information

column.name: patient_id
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: patient_id
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: filled_by_id
column.comments: UNUSED - will be removed in the future

column.name: pharmacy_id
column.comments: The internal identifier for the pharmacy that is connected to this prescription

column.name: provider_id
column.comments: The id of the user that created this prescription

column.name: drug_id
column.comments: The id of the drug that was prescribed to the patient. 0 if the drug was manually entered

column.name: created_by
column.comments: The id of the user that initially created this record

column.name: updated_by
column.comments: The id of the user that last updated this record

table.name: immunizations
table.comments: Patient Immunizations

column.name: patient_id
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: administered_by_id
column.comments: The person that administered the immunization

column.name: created_by
column.comments: The user that created this record

column.name: updated_by
column.comments: The user that last updated this record

column.name: ordering_provider
column.comments: The provider that issued the order to administer this immunization

column.name: immunization_id
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='immunizations' and represents common list of immunizations the EMR works with

column.name: amount_administered_unit
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='drug_units' and represents the units of drug administered

column.name: manufacturer
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='Immunization_Manufacturer' and represents a list of immunization manufacturers

column.name: route
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='drug_route' and represents a list of immunization manufacturers

column.name: administration_site
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='immunization_administered_site' and represents the body sites where the immunization can be administered

column.name: information_source
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='immunization_informationsource' and represents where the source of information the immmunization is coming from originates

column.name: completion_status
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='Immunization_Completion_Status' and represents the status of the immunization

column.name: refusal_reason
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='immunization_refusal_reason' and represents the reasons the individual refused immunization

table.name: immunization_observation
table.comments: Individual observations for a specific immunization

column.name: imo_pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: imo_im_id
column.comments: The immunization record this observation is part of

column.name: imo_user
column.comments: The user that is recording the observation for this immunization

table.name: insurance_data
table.comments: Patient Insurance information

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: provider
column.comments: The insurance company that insures the patient

column.name: policy_type
column.comments: Whether this is the 'primary', 'secondary', or 'tertiary' insurance

table.name: insurance_companies
table.comments: Insurance company

column.name: ins_type_code
column.comments: The type of insurance company this record is

table.name: insurance_type_codes
table.comments: Contains a list of different insurance types or categories that an insurance company is related to. This type includes both public and private payer types

table.name: pnotes
table.comments: Patient Messages about the healthcare treatment of the patient

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: message_status
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='message_status' and represents the status of the message

table.name: patient_reminders
table.comments: Patient Reminders generated from the clinical decision support engine that are sent via a communication medium to the patient

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

table.name: rule_patient_data
table.comments: Patient Reminders that the Clinical Decision Support system is configured to run for this specific patient.

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

table.name: rule_action_item
table.comments: Patient Reminders configuration for Clinical Decision Support individual rule settings

table.name: extended_log
table.comments: Holds the disclosures of EHI made to third parties for a given patient

column.name: patient_id
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

table.name: amendments
table.comments: Holds requests to amend health care information typically initiated by the patient or an insurance company

column.name: amendment_id
column.comments: Primary key for the amendment record. It uniquely identifies each amendment.

column.name: amendment_date
column.comments: The date when the amendment request was made.

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: amendment_by
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='amendment_from' and represents who is requesting the amendment

column.name: amendment_status
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='amendment_status' and represents the current status of the amendment

column.name: created_by
column.comments: The id of the user that initially created this amendment

column.name: modified_by
column.comments: The id of the user that last modified this amendment

column.name: amendment_desc
column.comments: Detailed information about the amendment, including any additional notes or changes.

column.name: created_time
column.comments: Timestamp indicating when the amendment record was created.

column.name: modified_time
column.comments: Timestamp indicating when the amendment record was last modified.

table.name: amendments_history
table.comments: Contains clinicinan comments regarding an amendment request

column.name: amendment_id
column.comments: The internal amendment id

column.name: amendment_status
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='amendment_status' and represents the current status of the amendment

column.name: created_by
column.comments: The id of the user that initially created this amendment

column.name: created_time
column.comments: Timestamp indicating when the amendment record was created.

column.name: amendment_note
column.comments: Comments regarding the amendment as entered by the creating user. Also contains a human readable description of the amendment status.

table.name: form_vitals
table.comments: Records of patient vital sign assessment

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

table.name: form_vital_details
table.comments: Record of a specific vital sign measurement, including its interpretation, and reason of the measurement

column.name: reason_status
column.comments: Valid values are 'completed','negated','pending' or '' for none

table.name: medex_recalls
table.comments: Tracks Patient Recalls. Recalls are when a patient should be reached out to or contacted for a healthcare followup.

column.name: r_ID
column.comments: Unique ID for the recall record

column.name: r_pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: r_facility
column.comments: FK facility.id associated with the recall

column.name: r_provider
column.comments: Provider ID associated with the recall FK to users.id

column.name: r_PRACTID
column.comments: UNUSED - Practice ID associated with the recall

column.name: r_eventDate
column.comments: Date of Appointment or Recall

column.name: r_reason
column.comments: Reason for the recall

column.name: r_created
column.comments: Timestamp when the recall was created

table.name: clinical_plans
table.comments: The Clinical Quality Measures that are being applied to a specific patient to track. This is used in the clinical reminders system

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

table.name: openemr_postcalendar_events
table.comments: Holds records for Patient Appointment/Calendar information

column.name: pc_eid
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: pc_pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: pc_catid
column.comments: The appointment category

column.name: pc_aid
column.comments: The provider this appointment is connected to

column.name: pc_gid
column.comments: The therapy group id this appointment is for

column.name: pc_facility
column.comments: The facility for where the service for this appointment will be rendered

column.name: pc_apptstatus
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='apptstat' if it is a single patient appointment OR list_options.list_id='groupstat' if this is a group appointment. It represents the current appointment status checked in, checked out, waiting, etc

column.name: pc_room
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='patient_flow_board_rooms' and represents the facility room that the patient has been assigned to for this appointment if one has been assigned

column.name: pc_billing_location
column.comments: Billing facility location of the event

column.name: pc_informant
column.comments: User creating the event

column.name: pc_prefcatid
column.comments: Preferred category id for a provider available slot

column.name: pc_multiple
column.comments: Multiple occurrences of the event. Used if this is a recurring appointment.

column.name: pc_title
column.comments: Title of the event

column.name: pc_time
column.comments: Time of the event

column.name: pc_hometext
column.comments: Description of the event

column.name: pc_comments
column.comments: Comments associated with the event

column.name: pc_counter
column.comments: Event counter

column.name: pc_topic
column.comments: Topic id of the event

column.name: pc_eventDate
column.comments: Date of the event

column.name: pc_endDate
column.comments: End date of the event

column.name: pc_duration
column.comments: Duration of the event

column.name: pc_recurrtype
column.comments: Recurrence type of the event

column.name: pc_recurrspec
column.comments: Recurrence specification of the event

column.name: pc_recurrfreq
column.comments: Recurrence frequency of the event

column.name: pc_startTime
column.comments: Start time of the event

column.name: pc_endTime
column.comments: End time of the event

column.name: pc_alldayevent
column.comments: Indicates if the event is an all-day event

column.name: pc_location
column.comments: Location of the event

column.name: pc_conttel
column.comments: Contact telephone number

column.name: pc_contname
column.comments: Contact name

column.name: pc_contemail
column.comments: Contact email address

column.name: pc_website
column.comments: Website associated with the event

column.name: pc_fee
column.comments: Event fee

column.name: pc_eventstatus
column.comments: Event status -1=hidden,0=queued,1=approved

column.name: pc_sharing
column.comments: Sharing status of the event

column.name: pc_language
column.comments: Language of the event

column.name: pc_sendalertsms
column.comments: Send SMS alerts for the event

column.name: pc_sendalertemail
column.comments: Send email alerts for the event

column.name: uuid
column.comments: UUID of the record

table.name: openemr_postcalendar_categories
table.comments: Contains the types / categories a patient scheduled appointment can be

column.name: pc_catid
column.comments: Auto-incremented identifier for the appointment category

column.name: pc_constant_id
column.comments: Identifier for the appointment category which is referenced in the codebase for appointment specific functionality

column.name: pc_catname
column.comments: Name of the appointment category

column.name: pc_catcolor
column.comments: Visual display color associated with the appointment category

column.name: pc_catdesc
column.comments: Description of the appointment category

column.name: pc_recurrtype
column.comments: Type of recurring appointment 0=Not recurring,1=Recurring appointment

column.name: pc_enddate
column.comments: End date of the appointment

column.name: pc_recurrspec
column.comments: Specification for recurring appointments in php array serialized format. Includes information on the repeating frequency, the type of repeat (daily, weekday,week,monthly, etc)

column.name: pc_recurrfreq
column.comments: Frequency of recurring appointments

column.name: pc_duration
column.comments: Duration of the appointment in seconds

column.name: pc_end_date_flag
column.comments: Flag indicating the use of an end date for the appointment

column.name: pc_end_date_type
column.comments: Type of end date for the appointment

column.name: pc_end_date_freq
column.comments: Frequency of the end date

column.name: pc_end_all_day
column.comments: Flag indicating if the end date is all-day

column.name: pc_dailylimit
column.comments: Limit on daily appointments for the category

column.name: pc_cattype
column.comments: Type of category used in grouping categories

column.name: pc_active
column.comments: Flag indicating the category is active

column.name: pc_seq
column.comments: Sequence number for the category

column.name: aco_spec
column.comments: Access control for the category. Empty on export

table.name: patient_tracker
table.comments: Patient appointment events that occur in the system. Used in the patient flowboard and for patient data reporting

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate ID of the patient tracker record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: eid
column.comments: The calendar appointment id

column.name: original_user
column.comments: This is the user that created the original record

column.name: encounter
column.comments: The encounter the patient appointment is connected to

column.name: date
column.comments: The datetime this tracker event was created

column.name: apptdate
column.comments: The appointment date this patient tracker record applies to

column.name: appttime
column.comments: The appointment time this patient tracker record applies to

column.name: random_drug_test
column.comments: Tracks if the patient should be given a randomized drug test. NULL if not randomized. If randomized, 0 is no, 1 is yes

column.name: drug_screen_completed
column.comments: Tracks if the patient has completed a drug screening. 0 if no, 1, if they have completed a drug screening

table.name: patient_tracker_element
table.comments: Used for tracking individual state changes in the appointment/encounter of a patient

column.name: pt_tracker_id
column.comments: maps to id column in patient_tracker table

column.name: seq
column.comments: This is a numerical sequence for this pt_tracker_id events and in combination with the pt_tracker_id uniquely identifies this record

column.name: start_datetime
column.comments: The datetime this tracker element event was created

column.name: room
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='patient_flow_board_rooms' and represents the facility room that the patient has been assigned to and this tracker element is connected to

column.name: status
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='apptstat' if it is a single patient appointment OR list_options.list_id='groupstat' if this is a group appointment. It represents the current appointment status at the time this tracker element was created

column.name: user
column.comments: This is the user that created this element

table.name: documents
table.comments: Stores all of the digital documents that are connected to a patient.

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: uuid
column.comments: Binary of Unique User Identifier that is for both external reference to this entity and for future offline use.

column.name: type
column.comments: Type of the document (e.g., 'file_url', 'blob', 'web_url')

column.name: size
column.comments: Size of the document in bytes

column.name: date
column.comments: Date when the document was created

column.name: date_expires
column.comments: Date when the document expires and is no longer available.

column.name: url
column.comments: URL of the document

column.name: thumb_url
column.comments: URL of the document's thumbnail

column.name: mimetype
column.comments: MIME type of the document

column.name: pages
column.comments: If the document is a multi-page format like tiff and has at least 1 page this will be 1 or greater,if a non-multi-page format this should be null or empty

column.name: owner
column.comments: Foreign key identifier to users of who initially persisted the document

column.name: revision
column.comments: Timestamp of the last time the document was changed and persisted

column.name: foreign_id
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: docdate
column.comments: Date (YYYY-MM-DD) logically associated with the document, e.g. when a picture was taken.

column.name: hash
column.comments: Hash value of the document from when it was uploaded

column.name: list_id
column.comments: FK to lists.id associated with the document when the document is related to an issue

column.name: name
column.comments: Name of the document. Populated since OpenEMR versions 6.0.0+

column.name: drive_uuid
column.comments: UUID of the document's drive. Empty in export

column.name: couch_docid
column.comments: CouchDB document ID

column.name: couch_revid

table.name: notes
table.comments: Clinical notes and comments for individual patient documents

column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key

table.name: forms
table.comments: Patient chart forms that are connected to a patient's encounter visit. Serves as the base record containing all of the common form encounter properties where each sub-type form has data records contained in a table that is named CONCAT('form_',formdir)

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: date
column.comments: Date of the form

column.name: encounter
column.comments: ID of the associated encounter

column.name: form_name
column.comments: Name of the form

column.name: form_id
column.comments: ID of the specific form instance

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: user
column.comments: User responsible for creating this form.

column.name: groupname
column.comments: The groupname that created this record.

column.name: authorized
column.comments: Authorization status

column.name: deleted
column.comments: Flag indicating if the form has been deleted

column.name: formdir
column.comments: Directory name of where the form exists in the filesystem. Also is the suffix name of the sub-type form that holds the individual form data for this form. The full table name is CONCAT('form_',formdir)

column.name: therapy_group_id
column.comments: ID of the therapy group that this form's encounter session is connected to

column.name: issue_id
column.comments: References lists.id to identify the medical issue this form is connected to

column.name: provider_id
column.comments: References users.id to identify the provider who is responsible for or involved in the healthcare this form relates to. This field is only populated in some types of procedure order forms and when a form is a dynamic Layout Based Form (LBF)

column.comments: The party for whom payment was last received. -1=Nobody, 0=Patient, 1=Ins1, 2=Ins2, 3=Ins3

table.name: procedure_order
table.comments: A procedure order is an encounter form within a patient visit representing an order for one or more procedures and its associated report/results for the procedure. Orders can be for either internal or external procedure providers

column.name: procedure_order_id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the procedure order record

column.name: uuid
column.comments: UUID of the record

column.name: patient_id
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: provider_id
column.comments: References users.id, representing the ordering provider

column.name: encounter_id
column.comments: References form_encounter.encounter, representing the encounter for the order

column.name: date_collected
column.comments: Time the specimen was collected

column.name: date_ordered
column.comments: Date and time the order was placed

column.name: order_priority
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='ord_priority' and represents the priority of the order

column.name: order_status
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='ord_status' and represents the status of the order (pending, routed, complete, canceled)

column.name: patient_instructions
column.comments: Instructions to be given to the patient for the procedure

column.name: activity
column.comments: 0 if the record is deleted, 1 if the record is active

column.name: control_id
column.comments: Control ID sent back from the lab

column.name: lab_id
column.comments: References procedure_providers.ppid and is the lab or provider of the procedure that will process the order and the order is being sent to

column.name: specimen_type
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='Specimen_Type' and represents the specimen type collected for the procedure

column.name: specimen_location
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='Specimen_Location' and represents the location the specimen was collected at

column.name: specimen_volume
column.comments: Volume of the specimen

column.name: date_transmitted
column.comments: Time of order transmission (null if unsent)

column.name: clinical_hx
column.comments: Clinical history text relevant to the order

column.name: external_id
column.comments: External identifier

column.name: history_order
column.comments: Indicates if the order is added for history purposes only. 0=No, 1=Yes

column.name: order_diagnosis
column.comments: Primary order diagnosis

column.name: billing_type
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='procedure_billing' and represents the kind billing being used for this procedure order (insurance, self-pay, etc)

column.name: specimen_fasting
column.comments: Fasting status of the patient at the time the specimen was collected. 0=Patient not fasting, 1=Patient was fasting at time of collection

column.name: order_psc
column.comments: Should the order for the Patient Service Center (PSC) be put on hold. 0=No, 1=Yes

column.name: order_abn
column.comments: The status of the US CMS Advanced Beneficiary Notice and whether the patient has already been given the ABN. Possible values are 'not_required'=Patient doesn't need an ABN, 'required'=Patient needs to be given an ABN before procedure can occur, or 'signed'=Patient has already been given an ABN and signed it.

column.name: collector_id
column.comments: References users.id, representing the individual that collected the specimen

column.name: account
column.comments: The specific name of the facility location associated with the order where the lab work will be sent from. This is typically used for LabCorp orders.

column.name: account_facility
column.comments: Facility Location associated with the order where the lab work is being sent from. This is typically used for LabCorp orders.

column.name: provider_number
column.comments: Provider number

column.name: procedure_order_type
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='order_type' and represents the type of procedure order this is (order, lab test, imaging, physical exams, etc

column.name: procedure_type
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='proc_type' and represents the kind of procedure_type this is ('group', 'order', 'discrete_result', etc')

table.name: procedure_providers
table.comments: This table holds both internal and external laboratories as well as other organizations that provide lab testing, results, and other procedures that can be ordered by a provider

column.name: ppid
column.comments: Surrogate ID of the record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: uuid
column.comments: UUID of the record

column.name: name
column.comments: Name of the laboratory or organization

column.name: npi
column.comments: National Provider Identifier (NPI)

column.name: send_app_id
column.comments: Sending application ID (MSH-3.1). Empty on Export

column.name: send_fac_id
column.comments: Sending facility ID (MSH-4.1). Empty on Export

column.name: recv_app_id
column.comments: Receiving application ID (MSH-5.1). Empty on Export

column.name: recv_fac_id
column.comments: Receiving facility ID (MSH-6.1). Empty on Export

column.name: DorP
column.comments: Debugging or Production (MSH-11). Empty on Export

column.name: direction
column.comments: Bidirectional or Results-only. Empty on Export

column.name: lab_id
column.comments: Laboratory ID

column.name: protocol
column.comments: Protocol for communication. Empty on Export

column.name: remote_host
column.comments: Remote host for communication. Empty on Export

column.name: login
column.comments: Login information for communication. Empty on Export

column.name: password
column.comments: Password for communication. Empty on Export

column.name: orders_path
column.comments: Path for orders. Empty on Export

column.name: results_path
column.comments: Path for results. Empty on Export

column.name: notes
column.comments: Additional notes or information. Empty on Export

column.name: lab_director
column.comments: ID of the laboratory director

column.name: active
column.comments: Indicates whether the provider is active

column.name: type
column.comments: Type of provider or organization

table.name: procedure_order_code
table.comments: Holds individual procedure / labs ordered from the procedure_type table for a given procedure order. It contains also the individual diagnosis code that is related to the ordered procedure

table.name: procedure_answers
table.comments: Answers to questions that are requested to be answered for a given procedure by a procedure provider (lab, or other provider)

table.name: procedure_questions
table.comments: Information/questions that should be answered for a given procedure as requested by the procedure service provider. Created as part of the procedure compendium import/creation process.

table.name: procedure_result
table.comments: The table stores the actual results and findings from medical procedures and tests, such as laboratory tests, radiology reports, diagnostic imaging, and other clinical tests.

column.name: procedure_result_id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: uuid
column.comments: UUID of the record

column.name: result_data_type
column.comments: N=Numeric, S=String, F=Formatted, E=External, L=Long text as the first line of comments

column.name: result_code
column.comments: LOINC code, might match a procedure_type.procedure_code

column.name: result_text
column.comments: Description of result_code

column.name: date
column.comments: Lab-provided date specific to this result

column.name: facility
column.comments: Lab-provided testing facility ID

column.name: units
column.comments: Units for the result

column.name: result
column.comments: Result data

column.name: range
column.comments: Result range

column.name: abnormal
column.comments: Abnormal values (no, yes, high, low)

column.name: comments
column.comments: Comments from the lab

column.name: document_id
column.comments: References documents.id if this result is a document

column.name: result_status
column.comments: Result status (preliminary, cannot be done, final, corrected, incomplete, etc.)

column.name: date_end
column.comments: Lab-provided end date specific to this result

table.name: procedure_report
table.comments: Procedure order overall report container for an ordered procedure result in procedure_order_codes which represents findings, conclusions, and recommendations for the procedure order

column.name: procedure_report_id
column.comments: Unique identifier for the procedure report. This is the primary key.

column.name: uuid
column.comments: Universally unique identifier for the procedure report.

column.name: procedure_order_seq
column.comments: References procedure_order_code.procedure_order_seq.

column.name: procedure_order_id
column.comments: References the procedure order for which this report is associated.

column.name: source
column.comments: References the user who entered this report data.

column.name: date_collected
column.comments: Date and time when the report was collected.

column.name: date_collected_tz
column.comments: Timezone offset from UTC for the date collected.

column.name: date_report
column.comments: Date and time when the report was generated.

column.name: date_report_tz
column.comments: Timezone offset from UTC for the date reported.

column.name: specimen_num
column.comments: A unique identifier for the specimen associated with the report.

column.name: report_status
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='proc_rep_status' and represents the current state/status of the report (e.g. received, complete, error)

column.name: review_status
column.comments: The status of the report review (e.g., pending review, received, reviewed).

column.name: report_notes
column.comments: Notes from the lab related to the report.

table.name: procedure_type
table.comments: This table holds a compendium of possible procedures and labs that can be ordered by the procedure ordering system within OpenEMR

column.name: procedure_type_id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: parent
column.comments: References procedure_type.procedure_type_id for heirarchies of procedure types

column.name: name
column.comments: Name for this category, procedure or result type

column.name: lab_id
column.comments: References procedure_providers.ppid, 0 means default to parent

column.name: procedure_code
column.comments: Code and code system identifying this procedure in the format of [codesystem:code]

column.name: procedure_type
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='proc_type' and represents the kind of procedure_type this is ('group', 'order', 'discrete_result', etc')

column.name: body_site
column.comments: Where to do injection, e.g. arm, buttock

column.name: specimen
column.comments: Blood, urine, saliva, etc.

column.name: route_admin
column.comments: Oral, injection

column.name: laterality
column.comments: Left, right, ...

column.name: description
column.comments: Descriptive text for procedure_code

column.name: standard_code
column.comments: Industry standard code type and code (e.g. CPT4:12345)

column.name: related_code
column.comments: Suggested code(s) for follow-up services if result is abnormal

column.name: units
column.comments: Default for procedure_result.units

column.name: range
column.comments: Default for procedure_result.range

column.name: seq
column.comments: Sequence number for ordering

column.name: activity
column.comments: 1=active, 0=inactive

column.name: notes
column.comments: Additional notes to enhance description

column.comments: The name of the type of the data element being tracked

column.comments: Description of the data element type being tracked

column.comments: This is a reference to a parent form_track_anything_type element. 0=There is no parent, if !0 then it is the track_anything_type_id for the parent element

column.name: position
column.comments: The order this element should be filled out in the track anything population mechanism

column.name: active
column.comments: 1=The element is active and allows for data entry, 0=data entry is disabled and the element is not displayed to the user

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate ID of the result record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: track_timestamp
column.comments: The time this result was recorded

column.name: itemid
column.comments: The data element that is being tracked for this result that is found in the form_track_anything_type table

column.name: result
column.comments: The user entered response for this data element being tracked

column.comments: The internal patient identifier.

column.name: template_content
column.comments: Digital document template that is assigned to a patient to be filled out. Uses Domain Specific Language (DSL) template tags to inject specific functionality into the template for patients to fill out. Patient data template tags can be found at the following URL: https://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/Patient_Portal_Document_Templates

table.name: onsite_signatures

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: type
column.comments: witness-signature

column.name: signer
column.comments: If type=witness-signature signer will be 'Witness Signature' if type='admin-signature' then signer will be the Username of the clinical staff member that signed, if type='patient-signature' then the value will be the patient's name

column.name: user
column.comments: User who created the esignature. If the signature is a staff member (administrator/witness) it will come from the users.username. If it is a patient signature the value will be '-patient-'

column.name: sig_image
column.comments: The image of the signature as a Data URI created from a browser Canvas object representing an image/png image of the signature

column.name: sig_hash
column.comments: sha3-512 hash of the sig_image

table.name: onsite_mail
table.comments: Patient asynchronous messages to and from clinical staff

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key

column.name: date
column.comments: Date and time of the message

column.name: owner
column.comments: Owner of the message. If this is a message intended for a patient this will be the patient_data.pid if it is for a user this will be the users.id

column.name: user
column.comments: User associated with the message

column.name: groupname
column.comments: Name of the group associated with the message

column.name: activity
column.comments: Activity associated with the message. 0=deleted, 1=message is active

column.name: authorized
column.comments: Authorization status of the message

column.name: header
column.comments: Header of the message

column.name: title
column.comments: Title of the message

column.name: body
column.comments: Body of the message

column.name: recipient_id
column.comments: ID of the message recipient. If a patient is sending this message to a user this will be the users.id, otherwise it is i the patient_data.pid

column.name: recipient_name
column.comments: Name of the message recipient. This will be the first and last name of the recipient.

column.name: sender_id
column.comments: ID of the message sender. If a patient is sending this message to a user this will be the patient_data.pid, otherwise it is the users.id

column.name: sender_name
column.comments: Name of the message sender

column.name: assigned_to
column.comments: Assignment information for the message

column.name: deleted
column.comments: Flag indicating whether the mail is deleted

column.name: delete_date
column.comments: Date and time when the message was deleted

column.name: mtype
column.comments: Message type ('Notification', 'Message')

column.name: message_status
column.comments: Status of the message ('Done','New')

column.name: mail_chain
column.comments: Mail chain ID

column.name: reply_mail_chain
column.comments: Reply mail chain ID

column.name: is_msg_encrypted
column.comments: Whether the message is encrypted (0-Not encrypted, 1-Encrypted)

table.name: onsite_messages
table.comments: Patient secure chat messages to and from clinical staff for real time communication

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate ID of the message record

column.name: username
column.comments: Username associated with the message sender This will be the patient's portal username if a patient sent the message. Otherwise it is the user's username if a user sent the message.

column.name: message
column.comments: The content of the chat message

column.name: ip
column.comments: IP address of the sender. Empty on export

column.name: date
column.comments: Timestamp of when the message was sent

column.name: sender_id
column.comments: ID of the message sender. This will be the patient_data.pid if a patient sent the message. Otherwise it is the users.id if a user sent the message.

column.name: recip_id
column.comments: JSON array of message recipients. If the message is being sent to one or more clinical staff it will be a JSON array of the usernames from the users table. If a user sends the message it will be a JSON array of one or more patient_data.pid ids. On EHI export this array is filtered to only include patient_data.pids that are in the the specific export task. These messages will be duplicated if patients are in different export tasks but received the same message.

column.comments: The patient encounter which resulted in this drug being sold to the patient.

column.name: sale_date

column.name: fee

table.name: ar_activity
table.comments: Accounts Receivable item entries in invoice/claim activity

column.name: pid
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: encounter
column.comments: The identifier for the encounter for which the payment is connected to (foreign key reference to the forms_encounter.encounter).

column.name: sequence_no
column.comments: A unique identifier for this payment activity, incremented in the code.

column.name: code_type
column.comments: The code system that is used for this billing activity

column.name: code
column.comments: The code in the code system referenced in code_type that is the main billing code for this billing activity

column.name: modifier
column.comments: Billing code modifier

column.name: payer_type
column.comments: The payer type code, indicating the source of payment (0=patient, 1=primary insurance, 2=secondary insurance, etc).

column.name: post_time
column.comments: The timestamp indicating when the payment was posted (in DATETIME format).

column.name: post_user
column.comments: The user ID (foreign key reference to the users table) of the person who posted the payment.

column.name: fee
column.comments: The billing fee that is being requested for payment of services rendered

column.name: post_time
column.comments: Time of the posting on the date referenced in post_date

column.name: session_id
column.comments: The session ID (foreign key reference to the ar_session table) associated with this payment activity, if applicable.

column.name: memo
column.comments: Additional comments or adjustment reasons related to the payment activity.

column.name: pay_amount
column.comments: The actual payment amount received (in DECIMAL format), which may differ from the fee amount due to adjustments or discounts.

column.name: adj_amount
column.comments: The adjustment amount, if any, to account for changes in the payment (in DECIMAL format).

column.name: modified_time
column.comments: The timestamp indicating when this payment activity was last modified (in DATETIME format).

column.name: follow_up
column.comments: A flag (CHAR) indicating follow-up actions needed for this payment activity (e.g., 'y' for yes, 'n' for no).

column.name: follow_up_note
column.comments: Additional notes or instructions related to follow-up actions for this payment activity (in TEXT format).

column.name: account_code
column.comments: The account code used to categorize or classify this payment activity (e.g., a billing code or account code).

column.name: reason_code
column.comments: An optional reason code used to explain adjustments or changes in the payment amount (e.g., primary payer adjustment reason code).

column.name: deleted
column.comments: A timestamp (in DATETIME format) indicating when the payment activity was deleted (NULL if active, otherwise when voided).

column.name: post_date
column.comments: The date (in DATE format) when the payment was posted, if specified at the time of payment.

column.name: payer_claim_number
column.comments: The claim number or reference number provided by the payer or insurance company for this payment activity.

table.name: ar_session
table.comments: Accounts Receivable overall payment made towards a patient invoice/claim and is the main table that holds the patient payments ledger

column.name: session_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for an accounting session, used as a surrogate key.

column.name: payer_id
column.comments: The insurance company being billed. If this is self-pay the id will be 0

column.name: user_id
column.comments: The reference to the user ID the created this billing session

column.name: patient_id
column.comments: The internal patient identifier

column.name: payment_type
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='payment_type' and represents the type of payment, such as if this is a patient or insurance payment.

column.name: adjustment_code
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='payment_adjustment_code' and represents the payment adjustment code to apply.

column.name: payment_method
column.comments: Comes from the list_options.list_id='payment_method' The method of payment, e.g., ACH, Cash, CC, Check, etc.

column.name: closed
column.comments: A flag indicating if the session is closed. 0 for open, 1 for closed.

column.name: reference
column.comments: The check or EOB (Explanation of Benefits) number associated with the payment.

column.name: check_date
column.comments: The date when the check was received for the payment.

column.name: deposit_date
column.comments: The date when the payment was deposited.

column.name: pay_total
column.comments: The total payment amount for the claim or billing invoice.

column.name: created_time
column.comments: The timestamp when the payment record was created.

column.name: modified_time
column.comments: The date and time of the last modification to the payment record.

column.name: global_amount
column.comments: The global amount for the payment.

column.name: description
column.comments: Additional description or notes related to the payment.

column.name: post_to_date
column.comments: The date when the payment is posted to the claim or billing invoice.

column.name: end_date

column.name: coverage_level

column.name: plan_description

column.name: coverage_period

column.name: percent

column.name: network_ind

column.name: message

column.name: response_create_date

column.name: response_modify_date
column.comments: Date when the benefit response was last modified

table.name: form_groups_encounter
table.comments: Represents the information related to a group of patient's visit to a healthcare provider. This is different than an appointment as this table tracks the actual service of care for a therapy group

column.name: id
column.comments: The primary key which is the same as the forms.form_id column

column.name: date
column.comments: Date and time of the encounter

column.name: reason
column.comments: The reason for the encounter

column.name: facility
column.comments: The facility or location of the encounter

column.name: facility_id
column.comments: Unique identifier for the facility where the encounter took place.

column.name: group_id
column.comments: FK to the therapy group that is attending for the encounter service

column.name: onset_date
column.comments: The date when the condition or issue for the group started

column.name: sensitivity
column.comments: Sensitivity information related to the encounter as to who should be able to access / view this encounter

column.name: billing_note

column.name: pc_catid

column.name: last_level_billed

column.name: last_level_closed
column.comments: The party for whom payment was last received. 0=None, 1=Ins1, 2=Ins2, 3=Ins3

column.name: last_stmt_date

column.name: stmt_count
column.comments: The statement count

column.name: provider_id

column.name: supervisor_id
column.comments: Supervising provider, if any, for this visit

column.name: invoice_refno
column.comments: Reference number for the invoice

column.name: referral_source
column.comments: Source of the referral

column.name: facility_id
column.comments: Unique identifier for the billing facility that will be used for this encounter.

column.name: billing_facility
column.comments: ID of the billing facility

column.name: external_id
column.comments: External ID associated with the encounter

column.name: pos_code
column.comments: Place of service code

column.name: counselors
column.comments: Information about counselors related to the encounter

column.name: appt_id

column.name: id
column.comments: The primary key which is the same as the forms.form_id column

column.name: group_id
column.comments: FK to the therapy group that this attendance form is tracking

column.name: user
column.comments: The username of the user that created this record.

column.name: groupname
column.comments: User Group that the user was part of that created this record (This is not the therapy group)

column.name: encounter_id
column.comments: The group encounter that this group attendance form is part of

column.name: authorized

table.comments: Track patient attendance to a therapy group session as contained in the Used by the form_group_attendance table

column.name: form_id
column.comments: The group attendance encounter form that is the container entity used to track this patient's attendance

column.name: meeting_patient_comment
column.comments: Comments about the participant's attendance in the meeting

column.name: meeting_patient_status
column.comments: The patient status in the meeting from the list_options.list_id='groupstat'

column.name: pid

table.name: therapy_groups

column.name: group_id

column.name: name

column.name: group_status
column.comments: Represents the current status of the therapy group. 10=Active, 20=Finished, 30=Canceled

column.name: group_type

column.name: group_participation
column.comments: Represents the participant requirements for the group. 1=Mandatory, 2=Optional

column.name: group_start_date
column.comments: Represents the date the group should start

column.name: group_end_date
column.comments: Represents the date the group should end

column.name: group_notes

column.name: group_guest_counselors

table.name: groups
table.comments: Represent groups of users in the system

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key.

column.name: name
column.comments: The name of the group.

column.name: user
column.comments: The username of the user that belongs to this group.

table.name: esign_signatures
table.comments: Holds the digital author signature records for encounters and individual charted forms in the system.

column.name: id
column.comments: Surrogate id of the record used as the primary incrementing key.

column.name: tid
column.comments: Table row ID for signature. This is either the forms.id or the form_encounter.encounter id

column.name: table
column.comments: Table name for the signature. This will either be 'forms' if it represents an individual form the provider is e-signing or 'form_encounter' if it represents the entire encounter record the provider is attesting to.

column.name: uid
column.comments: User id for the signing user.

column.name: datetime
column.comments: Datetime of the signature action.

column.name: is_lock
column.comments: Indicates whether the record is signed, locked, or amended.

column.name: amendment
column.comments: Amendment text, if any.

column.name: hash
column.comments: Hash of signed data. For an individual form_[formdir] this will be the hash of the string concatenation of all of the column values for the main entry table. For an overall encounter this will be the string concatenation of all individual form records that are connected to the encounter.

column.name: signature_hash
column.comments: Hash of the signature itself hash(tid,table,uid,is_lock,hash,amendment). sha1= less than 50 chars; greater than 50chars=sha3-512 algorithm.

table.name: pharmacies
table.comments: Contains records of pharmacies that a patient uses, or that providers interact with
